alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 1:26PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue for the Gardiner River, the lower Yellowstone River, and the Lamar River in Wyoming. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wyoming, including the following county, Park. * WHEN...Until 100 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM MDT, Gauge reports indicated continued streamflow. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mammoth, Tower Junction, Floating Island Lake, Blacktail Pond, Tower Falls, Osprey Falls, Roosevelt Lodge, Lava Creek Campgrounds and Indian Creek Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
